Reviews.Title: “Don't stay there if you are looking for Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ybaram
Reviews.Content: I wish those two reviews that were published on August 28, 2012 (day after I made my booking at the hotel), have been published earlier. The bottom line for this hotel is: don't stay there if you are looking for "airport" hotel. They don't have shuttle service. You can't go to there by any other public transportation (you either will not be able to find public transportation to the city center – if you have couple of hours free), and the Madrid taxi drivers just rip you off (22€ for 5 Min ride) Unlike most of the other hotels in the area, they charge you for the internet (3.95€ per hour or 10.8€ per day). The rooms are OK (nothing special for this level) and the service was also OK, but due to all the other weaknesses mention above (and in the previous reviews), I will not stay there again and I will not recommend to anyone who is looking for "airport hotel" in Madrid to stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible location, not at airport”
Reviews.Author: umichdave
Reviews.Content: We were booked to stay at this "airport" hotel on the night before flying back to the United States. We arrived back at the Madrid airport from Sevilla, only to learn that there was no hotel shuttle. Furthermore, the trains take longer to get to this hotel than other Holiday Inn hotels in the city because of the routes that are necessary (the trains are not direct from the airport at all). We ended up eating the cost of this hotel (the room we selected was pre-paid and non-refundable) and staying at the excellent, closer by train, and near more interesting entertainment, Hotel Pyramides by Holiday Inn. To take a taxi to this "airport" hotel, as others have mentioned, is disproportionately expensive. The fact that this "airport" hotel has no shuttle is just inexcusable. It is not walkable, either. As a Platinum Priority Club member who is generally very satisfied with properties in the Holiday Inn chain, I find all of this unbelievable. I would recommend staying at another one of the Holiday Inn properties in the city, or if you must stay near the airport, select a different property than this one.

Reviews.Title: “Too far from the airport”
Reviews.Author: tonyenglish
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel last night and its not good. Yes it is a budget hotel but it also gives you the impression that it is close to the airport, but its 29€ each way. There is no ATM there either, the closest bring back at the airport!!!. The room we were given suffered from road noise, had barely functioning air con and a bathroom that smelt a bit. We had an early flight so breakfast wasn't realty an option but did manage to get a coffee from the machine. The first cup I picked up had loads of chocolate in it and wasn't clean. To be honest I could put up with all its faults but to class this as an airport hotel is completely dishonest. If you stay here take plenty of cash...what you'll save on the room rate you'll be handing to a Madrid taxi driver. Its also notable that the Crowne Plaza is next footer and out has a shirker and they are part of the same group....so why doesn't this one. Staff are not helpful either

Reviews.Title: “OK if the A/C had been enough.........”
Reviews.Author: Traveler06232009
Reviews.Content: We stayed there before flying back home. Ideal location as far as being near the airport. It is just about a 10 minute drive to the terminal #1 at airport, so that was a BIG HELP. We found the place clean and updated. However, the A/C was not on when we arrived. Once we turned it on, it took most of the night to cool off. Our arrival at the hotel was no surprise, since we made our reservations 6 months before our arrival, so why they could not cool the rooms off that we had reserved ahead of time, I don't know.

Reviews.Title: “OK for 1 night”
Reviews.Author: mgs_svg
Reviews.Content: We stayed there as a family of 4 for one night each at the begining and end of our vacation. As other reviewers have noted it is some distance from the airport, depending on which terminal you are going to. It's closer to terminal 1-3 and about 10mintues further away from terminal 4. Cost from terminal 2 to the hotel was about 20 E, including the 5 E the taxi's charge for putting luggage in the boot). It also costs about 20E for a taxi into the city center. The main double bed was comfortable, the fold out sofa wasn't. We stayed here twice and the AC didn't work all that great in one of the rooms we stayed in. Rooms themselves were pretty nice and they were also clean. The rest of the hotel is pretty basic and not very inviting. Nothing in the area so we ate dinner in the city center. Overall, an ok place to send the night, but I wouldn't want to be there for much more than that.

Reviews.Title: “Warning!!!!”
Reviews.Author: HELEN S
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Madrid two nights at Holiday Inn Express Airport in my way to Cancun. This hotel looks clean but is not. In the middle of the night I woke up with a lot of insects around me. I had bites all over my body.They changed my room but I could not sleep anymore, because of the itches and the scare. So don't book this hotel!!!! It is awful!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel, definately not close to the airport, and no shuttle”
Reviews.Author: adrrny
Reviews.Content: This hotel is moderatey priced and has a fair interior and service for its price. The problem is that it is quite a distance from the airport terminals, and does not derserve its 'airport' name. There used to be a shuttle bus but it was cancelled a few years back. We had to take a taxi which cost 25 euros, so that gives you an idea of how close it is. The hotel is situated in an industrial area so there is no bars/ shops nearby, again 20 euros to nearest shopping centre. Overall you would be better off paying for a more expensive hotel in the city or at the airport terminals.

Reviews.Title: “Fit my needs”
Reviews.Author: NeroFlash
Reviews.Content: I spend 1 night at the Holiday Inn Express Madrid Airport because my Spanair flight was cancel due when spanair stop operation. The room was clean and it came with breakfast so it fit my need. The staff was helpfull. There is no shuttle complementary shuttle from and to the airport so you have to take a taxi which cost about 15-20 euro each way.

Reviews.Title: “Bugs in my bed!”
Reviews.Author: Asgoodaszagat
Reviews.Content: This place is not near the airport & they don't have an airport shuttle, the taxi driver charged us 27euros, next day to go back to airport it was 18 something euros? I called reception to ask for soap, they don't bringing up, so I had to come down to get it myself. Around 4:30 in morning I woke up, when I turned up the lights, there were 2 bedbugs, one was on my pillow, disgusting! My friend put them on a glass & took them to reception. We waited to talked to the manager. We will NEVER stay here & we will never recommend this place to anybody! My friend is going to complain to the corporate offices.

Reviews.Title: “Out of necessity”
Reviews.Author: Bespat
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel after finally being able to leave Morocco because of a delayed flight that wrecked all other plans, and my flight to America left until the next day. The first problem was that the shuttle is only on "call the hotel basis" it doesn't pick up guests as they know will arrive, and then the shuttle is not included, but you must pay 8 euros to use it, granted it's probably cheaper than a taxi, but they don't tell you this upfront. I requested soap several times and it was never delivered.

Reviews.Title: “This place is a hot mess.”
Reviews.Author: hernandez919
Reviews.Content: This hotel bore the tell-tale signs of a management team that has resigned itself to being a mediocre airport hotel... It's clear they are geared up for those of us who "just pass through". Here are a few points: 1. Staff: friendly and professional enough but just. 2. We changed rooms twice before settling in to a third. The first room had not been cleaned since the last guests and the second room was hot-box that faces the sun... The AC system was just not up for the 40 Celsius temps... 3. Ice machine downstairs... No ice buckets to be found. We ended up using the electic kettle. 4. Iron and board: yes, with a 50 € deposit. First iron leaked all over the lobby floor and was quickly returned as defective. Second iron had a broken water reservoir too. There was NO third iron! 5. We had two rooms... The remote control was broken in one room and the telephone was broken in another. We arrived about 3pm on a Friday... No maintenance person was on hand... 6. The hallways - walls and carpets - need some TLC. 7. While the pillows were conveniently marked "Firm" and "Soft", the beds might as well have been marked "rock solid, worn, and springy". Overall, As others before me have written... Stay here only if you have to! I'm usually not so hard on hotels, mostly because I know too many people who break their backs working hard in housekeeping, at front desks, and in maintenance in hotels around the world... but this just has to be said. Do better.

Reviews.Title: “Unfriendly service, no wifi, no airport shuttle, no public transportation,”
Reviews.Author: Chicharone
Reviews.Content: We usually stay at Holiday Inn Express in the U.S. and needed a place to stay before our flight left Madrid, so decided to give this a try. It turned out to be one of the biggest mistakes we made on our Spain trip. The front desk staff (despite changing shifts three times) was consistently unfriendly and in some cases, downright rude. The cost for a double room was 69 euros which includes a mediocre breakfast. Breakfast is served starting at 7 A.M. which is helpful if you have an early flight. There is no wifi at all in this hotel unless you pay for it. They claim to have a "business center" but it is basically some computers and a printer in the restaurant and it is not free (as it is in all of the other HIE we have patronized in the U.S.) Despite it's name, this hotel isn't close to the International Terminal. We assumed that it would have an airport shuttle but it didn't and it ended up costing us 23 euros to get to the Airport. The Crown Plaza next door, which is part of the Holiday Inn group of hotels, does have a free airport shuttle, but you may only use it if you are staying there not at the HIE. The room has air conditioning which you will need to use to block out the traffic noise. There was something in the ventilation system here which caused both of us to cough whenever we were in the room (this stopped as soon as we left the hotel). The carpets throughout the hotel are stained and the hallways are dark. There is very little lighting in the room and the reading lights are terrible. Once you arrive at the hotel, the only places to eat are at the hotel restaurant which has a very limited selection of items or at the Crown Plaza next door. Getting back into Madrid requires an expensive taxi ride or using the metro, which is a challenge if you don't speak Spanish. You must walk about 1/2 mile down Avenida de Aragon to the bus stop. From there, you will need to cross over the freeway and wait for the bus on the other side. It is 2 euros to take the bus to the Metro and takes approximately 10 minutes. On the return ride, the bus will drop you off on the same side of the freeway as the Holiday Inn Express (another 2 euros for the return trip). Better yet, avoid this hotel completely and stay at one of the hotels that is near the Metro line and the Airport.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all costs”
Reviews.Author: landonroussel
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at at number of Holiday Inn Express hotels before and can say unequivocally that this one should be avoided at any costs for the following reasons: 1. horrible customer service--when we asked to be transferred to the food ordering service, they delayed 15 min and then acted as if it were our fault that they did not transfer us; also, when I asked for an ice bucket, they gave me a plastic bag, which immediately broke from under when I filled it with ice 2. location is AWFUL--as Madrid residents, we know the transport system, and it is a MESS to take the public bus to get here; and if you want to pay the taxi, it will be 23€, as there is a 5€50 surcharge for going to/from the airport, making total expenses amount to the price of a more expensive hotel with a SHUTTLE bus 3. breakfast is HORRIBLE--perhaps the worst I've seen in a Holiday Inn. The coffee machine hardly worked (giving me more water than coffee), the cold cuts look like they were sitting in the fridge for days and the fruits come from a can 4. Internet costs money, when most Holiday Inn Expresses tend to provide internet for free In short, stay away from this place unless absolutely necessary

Reviews.Title: “scary”
Reviews.Author: priti j
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in industrial area and nearest bus stop is 10 to 15 minute walk. Please make sure to walk back in group of 7or 8 people when coming back late night. We were stopped by 3 muggers, who introduced themselves as police in civil clothes; they asked to show our passport and other items. We just kept talking and during that I memories the license plate number. Luckily we left all our items in hotel safe. Walkway was near highway which was in not favor of those muggers. We barely escaped and ran to the hotel ,when I reported that to “Ismail” the front desk person, he said “ya ya this place is not very safe late night. I was so angry with the hotel staff for not telling this in advance. I gave them the license plate number and checked in the morning again if they contacted with police but they didn’t do anything. It was very unpleasant stay. I didn’t expect that from holiday inn.

Reviews.Title: “Not near the airport”
Reviews.Author: abbernstein
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because we thought it was near the airport. We discovered that even though it's called Holiday inn airport you have to take a taxi to get to the airport. There is no shuttle. The service wasn't great and the staff were not very happy to help.Even for the the Wi Fi we had to pay- 10 eur per night.

Reviews.Title: “Does its job”
Reviews.Author: butchdingle
Reviews.Content: I have just come back from a couple of days in Madrid and stayed at the Holiday Inn Express, The hotel is approx 3 miles (max) from the airport but taxi drivers wanted €35 to do the journey,tut tut. In the end we spoke to a kiosk inside and got there for €16 so over half the price,hotel reception was very helpful and provided us with the room we wanted which was different to what we originally booked. Continental breakfast was included in the price and was typically cold meats,cheese,selected cereals , variety of breads and rolls,yogurts fruit juices and tea and coffee. Decide to take advantage of the wifi in the hotel room so approx €11 for 24 hours but got my monies worth. There were a couple of vending machines near the lifts that did sandwiches,chocolate,crisps and soft drinks and water at typical vending machine prices. Tea time they had a limited menu of food but the burger and chips we had was very nice. In short this hotel was somewhere to lay my head whilst away and it did just that and it did that really well. Would stay again

Reviews.Title: “My worst ever hotel experience. Really bad”
Reviews.Author: jthomas1974
Reviews.Content: I made a reservation at this hotel assuming it was every other airport hotel I had stayed while waiting for a flight. BIG MISTAKE. This hotel is located in an industrial area and not in walking distance to anything, not even a bus. There is no cafe nor other food service. Our room was uncomfortably warm and I went to the front desk to ask how to cool it off. I was told that there is no air conditioning except for the summer. The windows only open 3 inches so there was no relief there and when you did open them, you got the jet noise. A menu in the room says they serve meals from 8pm to 10pm every night. Since there were no other places to eat, we went down there only to be told that they did not serve on Sunday Menu does not say that. Employees were rude and unhelpful. A terrible experience. Never again

Reviews.Title: “Horrible place - don't stay unless you have to”
Reviews.Author: TTex
Reviews.Content: Where to begin! There is no public transport, despite the hotel saying 'a short 5 minute walk'. There is a city bus stop at least .5 mile down a busy stretch of highway, but the bus is heading the wrong way. So if you are heading to M, you must cross the overpass as well. Cab to airport or M will be at least 25 Eu. Nowhere to eat, no stores to walk to. Filthy, old threadbare carpeting, no hallway lighting outside room, filthy grout in bathroom, cramped room. Threadbare, holey, and STAINED furniture, mattress disgustingly filthy. Breakfast in the lobby barely edible. Agree with others- hwy Motel 6 for $19 in US would be 5-star compared to this place. Pre-paid 59 Eu/nt for 3 nts, and left after first night. They gave me 3k holiday inn pts for my troubles. shameful

Reviews.Title: “Very average - but reasonable value”
Reviews.Author: Mr_Avios
Reviews.Content: Anyone who books here while sightseeing Madrid has not looked at a map! This is an airport hotel and that's it, so don't expect a decent location or amenities: they don't exist, but for a one night stay you can't complain at 60Euros. Finding somewhere to eat is a challenge: I went to the hotel next door! The only critisism: apart from the restaurant looking like a school dining room and no real bar, is that it's at least 15mns driving to some of the terminals and you really do need a sat-nav to negotiate possibly the world's most complicated motorway network around an airport I've seen, so leave plenty of time.

Reviews.Title: “Not as expected”
Reviews.Author: RainsGA
Reviews.Content: There was no wake up call, the room was cramped and the wall next to the bed was very dirty. We were only given one wash cloth for 2 people and had to ask for a second one. It is NOT close to the airport, nothing in the vicinity within walking distance and no shuttle to the airport. There is a Crown Plaza right across from it and I am sure much nicer at a much higher price. All Holiday Inn Express in the US have a good breakfast. This one had the same thing every day ~ no fresh fruit, only canned and the worse tasting yogurt I have every tasted.

Reviews.Title: “A travelers trap”
Reviews.Author: numisrev
Reviews.Content: Located far from the Airport, no shuttle, nothing around the area, poor food service (very poor) Unexperienced personal, no wake-up call. Small rooms, clean and quiet. The hotel is new but the staff, wile courteous , very unexperienced .Overpriced!

Reviews.Title: “Average.”
Reviews.Author: tyrannicide_01
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located on the highway outside the Madrid Airport. They have no shuttle to the airport; no bar; no pool; no dining facility (except that for breakfast); no cash machine and -- no room service. On the other side of the coin, the staff was very nice and the rooms are clean and decently appointed. The shuttle to the airport is a *must*. How -- I ask you friends -- can you have an airport hotel without a shuttle to the airport? All and all, utterly average. If the staff had not been so good, this would have been a 2 star review.

Reviews.Title: “very avarge”
Reviews.Author: steven01234567689
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a good location next to a bus station, which will take you to the metro station, to go to any sight seeing...which will take approximatly half an hour and 8 euros for 2 per day. Good sizes rooms, clean, nice bathroom. The croissants for breakfast and bread is like 5 days old, must be useing the leftovers from dinner or any supermarket. Difficult to find ppl talking english (for heavens sake). Generally ok for a couple for a day or 2.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for short overnight”
Reviews.Author: Chris3436
Reviews.Content: For a short overnight, close to Madrid airport, perfect place. Rooms are clean and package is what one expects at Holiday Inn Express. What really makes the difference is as always..the staff. Veronica at reception welcomes with a great smile, very positive attitude and no questions are too difficult as she helped me out with obtaing an internet copy of important customer contract. Restaurant is basic but fair, again very friendly staff. WIFI works everywhere, easy. Comes at cost though. If you cannot sleep in the city, perfect value for money and more, given the staff's attitude. Entrance to hotel you cannot get to from the express road, take a 1st right after passing the hotel, it will be in that quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Very good rooms, location not too good if you don't have a vehicle.”
Reviews.Author: Maz Lester
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at the hotel, I stopped over on my trip from Santander to Murcia. I was greeted by a friendly receptionist who answered all my questions.The room was clean and very comfortable with clean linen provided. Dinner was inexpensive and although the menu is not extensive it was certainly tasty and hot. Served by a polite and friendly waiter. The complimentary breakfast was continental and basic (ceareal, toast, croissant etc) but enough for me. Overall I would recommend this hotel if you're passing through! The location was probably not good if you didn't have a vehicle but that didn't bother me as I did have one.

Reviews.Title: “Close to airport”
Reviews.Author: Vienna-Paul
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews, I was hesitant to stay here but the value was great. We arrived late from a drive back from Portugal and needed to fly out the next morning. The rooms were quiet, clean, and the man at the front dest was quite helpful. I only reserved 1 room with a full size bed and a sleeper sofa but he was able to give me 2 connecting rooms 1 with a full bed for my wife and myself and a room with 2 single beds for my young sons. One of the rooms was a handicap room and the drain in the shower smelled bad so we used the bathroom in the other room. food was ok, you don't want to walk outside the hotel, not dangerous, just in an industrial part of town. Parking was free, it is a 20 euro taxi ride to airport, 15 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Holiday Inn, never will be back...”
Reviews.Author: 54lillian
Reviews.Content: This is the worst hotel we've ever been. The staff is really rude, and are not efficient. We arrived at 4:30 pm and though we are Platinum, and already payed for our reservations, they did not have the rooms ready, we had to wait until 5:00 pm to have our rooms. They did not apologize for this mistake, instead they keep saying that it was not their fault (whose then?)They charged us for wi-fi internet 12 euros for each room per day, the breakfast, was terrible, really poor. We will never return to this hotel, and would not recommend it to anybody. This hotel should not be named Holiday Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Do not go: Terrible welcome, decoration is vulgar, and is not near the airport”
Reviews.Author: princesaguacamole
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay in this hotel since it was announced that it has shuttle to the airport and we had to come back and forward several times, No shuttle. Each time we went to the airport it was 30 Euros They tried to change the price when we arrived from 50 to 62 Euros for a no sense reason even when we have reserved via the holiday inn webpage. When we had breakfast they took it, literally from our hands because it was already 10 am and they do not serve breakfast after that time. Decoration theme is vulgar: Red lights in the room, mirrors in the bath tube, shadow screen between the bathroom and the bed give a "table dance" look to the place. The positive points are that it was clean, we had a late arrival and there was someone in the front desk. .

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable rates”
Reviews.Author: Avis S
Reviews.Content: We had to overnight in Madrid on our way home from Venice. Booked this on the internet (Travelocity) on the cruise ship the night before. It was $85 USD and the room was clean. The hallways weren't impressive, but the room was nice for the price and just an overnight. They serve complimentary breakfast and you can pay for dinner. We went across next door to the Crowne Plaza and had a decent dinner. We would stay there again. Paid internet is available on computers in the lobby

Reviews.Title: “Cheap prepaid prices EXPENSIVE TRANSPORTATION ACCESS”
Reviews.Author: cmentonelli
Reviews.Content: No access to public transportation. Not pedestrian friendly..Taxis and shuttles for 20 Euros or more will add to expenses. No soap in bathroom. No stopper in tub. Marks on wall. Location information on website and at call center unclear about accessibility to airport and city center.

Reviews.Title: “great over nighter”
Reviews.Author: mosma2
Reviews.Content: Neat, clean and decently priced Book in advance to save Far from town and taxies are exspensive Almost no parking available in middle of the town I could easily recommend this place to my friends

Reviews.Title: “No hotel shuttle”
Reviews.Author: Johnacoles
Reviews.Content: I stayed here just for one night and was very disappointed with the lack of airport shuttle to this hotel, asked a taxi driver and he quoted me 25euro's for a 5 minute ride, what a rip off!! So I decided to walk....BIG MISTAKE!! To walk from terminal 1 to the hotel took me an hour and is about 4 miles along busy roads and rough areas. Once at the hotel the room was OK and comfortable but the breakfast was complete crap (unless you like croissants and cold ham and cheese). So my suggestions are that if you are not to bothered with breakfast and have a car then it is the ideal place, if not STAY CLEAR......You have been warned John Coles

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: kjones83
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here for one night before our early flight back to the States. The restaurant downstairs smelled horrible, every carpet was stained, both room phones did not work and there was no hot water. The staff did not seem to care one bit that the very basic necessities were not met. DO NOT STAY HERE!

Reviews.Title: “Any hotel but this one”
Reviews.Author: beenaround123
Reviews.Content: Worst hotel I have ever stayed in-and I travel quite a bit. Very scary neighborhood-one hotel across the street and the rest of the area is like a bombed out city-buildings either built-but completely empty with no windows or buildings half built and abandoned. You don't want to walk ten feet from this hotel in daylight and for sure after sunset. No shuttle- stains in carpet all over common areas of hotel and I guess I should mention they had no hot water for showers. I will never stay in a Holiday Inn hotel of any kind ever again-I knew it wasn't a great line of hotels but this was a disaster.

Reviews.Title: “No Shuttle - expensive taxi”
Reviews.Author: mosmall
Reviews.Content: The website where I booked the hotel claimed that it had a shuttle - the only reason I selected the hotel. It was a nightmare trying to get there since my plane was late and it was nearly 1 am and the taxis did not want to take me since it was not far enough for them. Finally got one and it was nearly 20 euros - guy at the desk was very rude and the lights in the room did not work at all. The room was clean but the breakfast was terrible. I thought maybe I could walk back to the airport but it is quite a ways through a dangerous industrial wasteland. In short, do not stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Better to sleep in the airport terminal instead for your safety.”
Reviews.Author: Bellatravel47
Reviews.Content: We were robbed during the check in process right in the lobby. Lost a bookbag containing essential medication. Staff did not care. Not even to say too bad about that. Lobby was like a wild bus station/restaurant. Line at desk never ended and you had to wait in it to ask each question during our emergency. GPS could not find the place. Took us 3 hours while within 2 miles of the hotel to find it. This was after 2 weeks of driving in Spain with no problems. Repeated calls to the front desk produced annoyed response, but no real help. Front desk at an upscale hotel nearby finally told us how to get there. As others have said, this place is nowhere near convenient for the airpot. I too mad this reservation in haste because it said "airport. It is near a major highway and the huge airport is spread out on the other side. Because of our late ariival due to not being able to find the place, then the theft and very scary and expensive calls back to the U.S. to get replacement meds for a serious condition, we kept our rental car overnight and had to pay for an extra day. Worked out better, because the ride to and from the car return from this place probably would have cost more than an extra day from Avis. No one at the hotel even attempted to help us with the medical situation, but we found out through a contact living in Madrid that you can buy prescriptions over the counter in Spain. The next morning we got the meds at the airport pharmacy. You just have to figure out what the med is called in Spain. After a troubled night, we saw other guests in distress looking in dumpsters and vacant lots around the hotel the next morning. I suspect they also were victims of this unsafe, no security establishment. Lessons: know the name of your meds in Spain and get yourself an international cell phone. We used Telestial and will never leave home without it!

Reviews.Title: “65 Euros incl Bkfst. Who can beat that? Just location is problematic without a car...”
Reviews.Author: gobitz
Reviews.Content: It's darn cheap and i've never seen a HI Xpress hotel with a bath tub! Rooms are very modern and new, with a flat screen. Bkfst is quite ok, with yoghurts cereals, bread, cheese and ham. They serve some catered dinner in the evenings (not expensive). the area sucks - you need to take a bus (222, 223, 224, etc) three stops to Canillejas (green line) and from there on another 20 minutes to the center. The holiday is next to the A-2 highway to Zaragoza.

Reviews.Title: “NOT AN AIRPORT HOTEL!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: jetrun4327
Reviews.Content: I should have read the reviews!!!! booked this on the fly for one night sleep before an early flight, got to madrid and started looking for the shuttle bus (we tried to make a phone call to the hotel from the airport but gave up after 5 tries, the phone was to complicated!). Finally gave up and took a cab, but the cab driver had never heard of the holiday inn express! he called someone for directions, then it was a 20 minute ride to the hotel, costing us 30 euros! Then he tells me no credit cards!!!!! Soooooo....I understand this is all my fault for assuming there would be a shuttle for the AIRPORT HOLIDAY INN EXPRESS, and then assuming the city cab would take VISA, and lastly, I ASSUMED that the place was close enough to the airport that it would not be more than 25 euros fare, which was all we had!!! The holiday inn express was perfectly adequate, and they gave us 3 euros to pay the driver because we were short (learned later only SOME of the cabs take credit cards, you have to ask first) The front desk staff here was AWESOME, very nice and accomodating ( I was very embarrassed to ask them for 3 euros) and they wouldnt let me pay them back, said it was not possible to add 3 euros to the bill (we did buy a bottle of wine though). Room was clean, although no a/c in the hotel, service was great and breakfast was fine, THE BIGGEST PROBLEM IS THAT IT IS ADVERTISED AS AN AIRPORT HOTEL WHEN IT IS NOT!

Reviews.Title: “Unsafe environment and high crime. Do not stay there.”
Reviews.Author: Mithawala
Reviews.Content: My wife's purse was stolen in the parking lot in broad day light as I was checking out of the hotel. She lost all her IDs, money, and passport. Needless to say, it destroyed our vacation. The hotel is not very close to the airport and it cost 30 Euro taxi ride to get there. It is in a secluded area which is easy for criminals to access. There is no security around the hotel. Do not be fooled by low prices and brand name.

Reviews.Title: “NOT AN AIRPORT HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: ragragrag
Reviews.Content: The Holiday Inn Express Madrid Airport hotel is located about 15 minutes from the airport by taxi. There is no shuttle service between this hotel and the airport. The one-way cab fare from the airport to the hotel is about 20 euros. This is the price we paid to the hotel after discovering, to dismay, that the hotel has no shuttle service. However, the cab driver booked by the hotel to take us back the the airport charged us 30 euros. This, we paid about 50 euros more for a night in this hotel than we would have spent at one of the many hotels that offers rooms at the same price but are closer to the airport and provide complimentary shuttle service. What a rip off!

Reviews.Title: “Basic accomodations - no airport shuttle”
Reviews.Author: GoSounders
Reviews.Content: Level of quality expected from a holiday Inn express, but contrary to other postings, did not have an airport shuttle. And while this may be one of the closer hotels to the airport, it is actually pretty far. Paid 28 Euro each way to from terminal to hotel. and 25 hotel to terminal the next morning. Don't get taken in by the inexpensive rate if you need to rely on the airport shuttle.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here”
Reviews.Author: Bololo41
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is not near the airport. the only way to get there is to take a taxi for 25 to 30euro, you better find another hotel downtown were you can go via the metro from the ariport for 2euro

Reviews.Title: “Adequate with some disadvantages especially location for seniors”
Reviews.Author: walkfoot
Reviews.Content: Hotel was clean. The ladies at the front desk very charming and helpfull with accureate information concerning transportation to and from the city. Travelling to the city one had to walk a long distance and cross the highways over a high bridge to catch the bus, Also one had to walk a good distance in a dark and lonely area. My wife and I were robbed in broad daylight right in front of the hotel by 3 men in a car claiming to be police investigating criminal activity in the Hotel. We are Caribbean Blacks, but they calimed we were illegal immigrants from Africa. We do not blamed the Hotel, as the manager claimed it happened in the street, but seeing the hotel is in such a lonely spot it would have been helpful to have some sort of security to shoo aff predators. Otherwise the stay was good and Madrid great in spite of the cold and the rain

Reviews.Title: “Affordable stay nearby Madrid's airport - clean, updated & great service!”
Reviews.Author: lettybug74
Reviews.Content: Okay... I really was expecting the worst when I arrived here (because of all the bad reviews) but when I arrived I immediately realized that those who said this place was *awful* had unrealistic expectations. The staff were SUPER sweet & helpful! They taught us how to get around via public transportation, gave us advice on where to go, made our taxi reservation for the next day and did everything you would expect from good service. The location is definitely far from civilization.... it was about a 5 minute walk to the bus stop & 20 minute bus ride to the closest metro stop and there were no facilities nearby (although I heard the front desk accomodating someone's food delivery order for them). The rooms were tight on space but clean and definitely on the newer side. There was internet for a fee (too much for me to want to pay for it) and free continental breakfast. All of this for around 60 Euros? I'd say it's a pretty damn good deal! Not somewhere I'd want to stay as my primary destination for a good time in Madrid but definitely a good option to catch an early morning flight or for that traveler who's on a budget and doesn't mind the extra time investment to get around on public transportation.

Reviews.Title: “What the f* is everybody complaining about???”
Reviews.Author: ANS57
Reviews.Content: In my opinion, this hotel is exactly what it is supposed to be, and even better! An airport hotel, that for the modest price of €50.-, offers a nice clean room, bathroom and a breakfast buffet at 4.30h. in the morning for 2 persons! What the hell do you expect??? A violin player to welcome you?

Reviews.Title: “Terrible experience, should have read the reviews beforehand.”
Reviews.Author: westport63
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately our experience mirrors that of the reviews. Since they seemed to end in 2008, treat this as a reminder that things remain as they were. The hotel is still located in a waste land. No shuttle to the airport. It cost us $50 for a taxi. Staff seemed clueless. Stiff internet charges.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute pits! Avoid like the plague.”
Reviews.Author: THoopo
Reviews.Content: No food at the hotel or within walking distance. No airport van, and the 20 minute cab ride cost Euros 23 (half the cost of the room). Calling this an aiport hotel is terribly misleading, even though it's only a kilometer from the end of a runway.. No airconditioning except in summer. With the window open, it's too noisy to sleep; with the window closed, it's too hot to sleep. The room was generally clean but the carpet hadn't been changed since Moses was a boy. The staff tried to be helpful, but they couldn't compensate for this hotel's crushing disadvantages. This was the worst value of any of the hotels we stayed at in Spain, and I'll think twice about ever booking at a Holiday Inn Express again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Near Madrid Barajas Airport”
Reviews.Author: mineer
Reviews.Content: We stayed only one night, on our way to The Canary Islands. It was very comfortable and the internet worked. The internet was not free. I think I had to pay 13 Euros or something like that for 24 hours. Breakfast was OK, not great. The Staff was awesome and this Hotel had a Spanish Touch but offered the comfort and cleanliness which I would expect from a Holiday Inn Express. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid Holiday Inn Express Madrid”
Reviews.Author: MrEdgar
Reviews.Content: Took forever to find the place because Google maps has it all wrong, local folks never heard of Avenida de Aregon, and worst of all, the staff were unable to explain how to get there in either English or Spanish. We arrived so late that half of us went straight to bed without eating. The rest ordered Pizza delivery, but only available til midnight. Bar closes at midnight. As other posters stated, it is not near the airport (30 minute drive), there is no shuttle service, no restaurant in-house or within walking distance. This place is far from EVERYTHING. No way will I EVER stay at this joint again. I don't care how clean the room was. I wish I had read the reviews before hand.

Reviews.Title: “ok for an overnight stay”
Reviews.Author: sologal_10
Reviews.Content: I was prepared after reading the other reviews. I was afraid to stay there after reading them but after researching other hotels they didn't seem much better either and I had free night thanks to points. I got directions from mapquest for Spain and translated them using a free online service to spanish. I also drew a basic map and gave both to the taxi driver. This saved me money and time. Taxi to hotel was 14.75 euros and back to the airport in the morning was 20 euros. I also brought food with me and bottled water. The area around the hotel is vacant lots and unoccupied buildings. The staff spoke english and I had no problems communicating. The hallways smelled but my room did not and it was Clean and my bed was comfortable. The TV stations were in spanish so I paid for wifi which was $10.80 euros/day and was easy to hook up to. I had a good nights sleep and received my wake up call in the morning that I requested. Free breakfast in AM. No shuttle.

Reviews.Title: “NEVER AGAIN!!!”
Reviews.Author: tatjana001
Reviews.Content: I checked for a hotel near the airport and for some reason choose this hotel, since it clearly stated on the site that it wasn't that far fromm the airport. Well it took us about 15 min. to get there and then another 6 min. to find it since it was in a desserted place. Staff was VERY unfriendly non English speaking, no food so had to order pizza which was rank, no shops around unless u take a 15min. taxi to the centre, there was a vending machine which charged a lot at the hotel. Internet was not FREE but very expensive for a whole day, No english t.v. channels. It was boiling hot that time and the heaters was still on told the receptionist and he was I could get out of his non english self was that the fault was reported. Overall boring hotel to be in. The rooms were clean and all. But NO WAY WILL I EVER DO THAT AGAIN!!!

Reviews.Title: “Hated the Location but great Value”
Reviews.Author: Kss016
Reviews.Content: The room was dirty and when I had asked for a non-smoking room they gave me smoking. The front desk clerk was great because I called her and she changed my rooms right away. The bathrooms at this place were filthy. I never took my flip flops off. Also, the location of this place is not good at all. We had to spend a big fortune to get to this place from the airport. Lastly, do not depend on the night clerk cause she does not even know what station is closest to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely awful, name is a lie”
Reviews.Author: catalinadelsoto
Reviews.Content: Do not book this hotel. "Madrid Airport" is nearly half an hour away in an almost totally unpopulated area. There is no public transit, except for one bus that I think you have to run across the highway to catch. Only one of the taxi drivers at the airport had ever heard of it. It cost me THIRTY EUROS to get there and THIRTY EUROS to get back. The taxi driver was not ripping me off, was following the standard route that I'd looked at ahead of time, and I speak fluent Spanish so there was no language barrier. Total disgrace and waste of money. Shame on Holiday Inn. They've lost a future customer.

Reviews.Title: “Poor location”
Reviews.Author: Sofanon
Reviews.Content: This hotel is 4 stories, located across the street from the airport in a mostly-vacant pedestrian-unfriendly industrial park. If you aren't driving, you need a cab to get anywhere. There is a bus stop a few blocks away, but the bus schedule is confusing, and the staff are no help. It costs 23 Euros for the cab to the airport, as there is no shuttle. Returning the car to the airport is very confusing, with many stories reported of frustrated drivers going round in circles for hours trying to find the car return lot. The hotel hosts many large tour groups. The hotel itself is tired and poorly maintained, but the staff do a good job of cleaning. The baths are great. We spent an entire day in the room, and our pay-movie channels would not work, despite the best efforts of the hotel manager. We were offered another room where it would work, but declined, being too tired to move. Wi-fi is not free, but is available, at 4-13 Euros by the hour or day.The front desk staff speak English, but are not much help with area directions and attractions. The breakfast is good, with yogurt, cereal, rolls, canned fruit, lunchmeat and cheese. There is a large dining room, and a Spartan bar. Food can be ordered from nearby restaurants, but the pizza is nothing to brag about. The staff will call to order for you. The bottom line: it is close to the airport, and it is inexpensive, so it makes a convenient last stop before catching a plane. It is hard to find by car, harder still to drive to the airport car-return, and there is no airport shuttle. There is nothing nearby to walk to.

Reviews.Title: “The worst experience ever. Do not stay at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: ap242424
Reviews.Content: DO NOT BOOK TAXI through this hotel. They will rip you off and will not take where you need to go. Taxi drivers don't speak english and most importantly don't know what they are doing. I had the worst experienced in my life with them and hotel management did not nothing about it. But as far as I'm, concerned, they r responsible for this as much as taxi driver i had to deal with. I would not stay in this hotel ever again and hope you don't either.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Experience”
Reviews.Author: TJBSt_Louis_Missouri
Reviews.Content: Where to begin? This hotel was difficult to find, located in what appeared to be an unfinished industrial park. The hotel was the only occupied building for what seemed like miles. There was no on-site restaurant and, in fact, no restaurant anywhere nearby. We ended up cobbling dinner from what we could find at a gas station. We had selected this hotel for its proximity to the airport because we were flying out the next day. That proximity took on a whole new dimension when we realized that to get any air flow into the room we had to open the window and listen to the planes and freeway traffic for the whole night. We barely slept. Opening the window was a last ditch effort after our attempts to get the in-room air conditioning to work failed. My husband called the front desk who informed him that the master air conditioning was not turned on because it would get cool at night. It didn't. Only one elevator was working and, the next morning, looked to have been doused in spilled soda that hadn't been cleaned up. The breakfast buffet was a joke, which was particularly unfortunate considering our gas station dinner. If you do not have a car, I am not sure how you would find food. The hotel has nothing other than a vending machine. The parking lot is ridiculous. Despite having plenty of usable space, it is miniscule and difficult to navigate. The hotel appeared to have a garage which, for unexplained reasons, was not open. The room was clean, the bathroom was fine and the service was friendly. But I would NOT stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Think twice before you stay”
Reviews.Author: BristolAna
Reviews.Content: Adequate for an overnight stay between flights. Rooms clean and quiet considering the hotel is on a very busy road and at the end of one of the airport runways. Continental breakfast is included and is ok- cereal , ham ,cheese, rolls, cake ,juices and hot drinks. No airport shuttle and I think this is a big downside; the hotel is so near to the airport but so far. Taxi fares range from €20 to €40 depending on how much the taxi driver wants to rip you off. It’s cheaper to get the bus into Madrid city centre €1 and stay in town if you have the time. Other downside no food served in the evening only pizzas and Chinese delivered. (Quite expensive)

Reviews.Title: “GoodAirport hotel”
Reviews.Author: steve1708
Reviews.Content: Nothing fancy, but really good rates , staff all helpful, only negative I couldnt get the wireless network to work.

Reviews.Title: “Isolated Without a Car”
Reviews.Author: ASHWorldTravel
Reviews.Content: We used this hotel for a night before a very early flight from the airport. The website said local area shuttle, so we hoped it would bring us to the airport. They do not have an airport shuttle, and despite being only less than 10 minutes from the airport the taxi is between 20 and 25 Euro. We took a taxi there and back, so that added into the overall cost of the stay. The meters are irrelevant on the taxis, the drivers just make up an arbitrary price despite the calculation of the meter fare and the supplement listed. Beware. Once at the hotel, there are no restaurants close by. It is isolated on a highway. You definitely need a car. Otherwise, it was clean and fine, typical HIE.

Reviews.Title: “Good place if you have a car, clean, good complementary breakfast”
Reviews.Author: C-sprout
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 3 nights from Jul.27th to th 30th 2009. 2 adults and 1 teenager. RESERVATION: We got the reservation made online on the Holiday Inn website, the advanced purchased of a standard room. No problems with the reservation at all. We got what we wanted, a double bed with a sofa bed. This was great as we were visiting all day. LOCATION: By the highway ...get a good map it's hard to get to it as the exit on the mao is closed so need to go by the hotel on the highway and take the next exit. New hotel and others beeing built around so seem in the middle of no where. Little hard to get in and out of there the first time if you are not from there. GET TO TOWN: We had a car to get to town and paid the underground parkings as it was easier. There was a shuttle available to the airport as we saw it every morning and everynight, so for those that need it...can't say if it was on time but it was arriving and departing from the hotel for sure. THE STAFF: The staff was very pleasant and helpful even if busy at times. They gave us maps and explained places to see and where to eat. CLEAN ROOM: Room was clean and looks like all the Express by holiday inn hotels. No fridge, no safebox. There was a kettle and coffee envelopes. Good beds, little hard, but better that than a broken mattress. Sofa-bed was thin but teenagers can sleep anywhere : ) BATHROOM: Marble counter top in bathroom and NO anti-slip in the tub...BE EXTRA CAREFUL. They are all made the same ..easy to slip and hit your head on the counter-top behind you. BREAKFAST: Complementary breakfast was good but get up early as all the little families go in Holiday inns so.... the food goes fast. It is mostly croissants, toasts, cereales, yogourts and of course coffee....when the machine works. It is a self serve machine just like in hospitals or offices. There is no american type coffees...I use to click twice the expresso button and pour milk in it. OTHERS SERVICES: Internet 1 hr for 4 euros or about, a tiny bar to have a drink next to the reception. No restaurant in hotel, no pool. PARKING: 12 euros a night, but as there is nothing around outside...everyone parks on the street or around the hotel. We never got charged for it. OVERALL: I would go back there but not without a car as it is a little far from town, Can't go wrong with Holiday Inn's all over SPAIN !!

Reviews.Title: “And they don't use vasoline!”
Reviews.Author: Glenn V
Reviews.Content: A) Our flight into Madrid was late, so when we called the hotel for the shuttle at 10:05 PM we were told that the shuttle service stopped at 10:00, and take a taxi. The taxi drove the longgg way around (I turned on my GPS for part of the ride), so the fare ended up at 38.50 Euro for the most frightening ride (@ 80-90mph). The hotel staff's response was "It happens". B) AC was turned off (we could have heat if we wanted, but we didn't), so had to open windows to get some air flow -- along with highway and airport fumes and noises. C) Bed was firmer than anything we've experienced elsewhere in Europe, so my wife slept on the sofa, with her feet hanging over, and she's only 5' 3". D) No food anywhere near, we didn't feel like Chinese or Pizza delivery, and the sandwich from the vending machine was disgusting, so went to bed hungry. Notice that I rated "value" at the lowest --- and this was a "free" room night --- no I don't feel that I got any value for what I paid!!! Wish I had read these reviews earlier :-(

Reviews.Title: “Hard to get to airport, hard to get to city; In the middle of contruction and expressway, with no entrance.”
Reviews.Author: glennab33
Reviews.Content: We were offered free shuttle and then had to pay for it. I had any early flight and they wouldn't even give me the shuttle service. The cab service that arrived early started the clock before I even came at my designated time. We had to walk a mile to get to a bus and they wouldn't stop for some people.

Reviews.Title: “Not even worth the bargain price...”
Reviews.Author: Visidigi
Reviews.Content: A long stay in an IHG group hotel is always something of a lottery, my original 10 day reservation lasted three nights, and that was only due to other issues. I wouldn't say the hotel is bad, but it certainly has its problems. 9 euros for a shuttle each way is fine, if its clear when you arrive how you take that shuttle or at least order it. Its not, so it was 30 euros for the first taxi. Then there is another problem, there is nothing near it, and when asking reception your just flat told no, although you could order chinese or pizza for delivery. At 23 euros for a pizza and two cans of coke this place is not exactly cheap, and the affiliation with the pizza place is seeing them make some money out of thier promotion. Ironically the pizza was actually very tasty, but still not worth the £23/$35US any day of the week. The hotel has further problems, cleanliness, the bathroom wasn't clean, when the shower was turned on other peoples hair was floating on the water in the bath, the water which wouldn't drain away for 10 minutes AFTER you turned off the shower. I think my room must have been built on a Friday too, as running the water in the sink caused smelly water to come up through the drain in the bath - odd and repulsive at the same time. So after spending 2 Euros (£2/$3.40) on a can of diet coke from the vending machine I decided to switch to beer, which is actually quite nice from the hotel 'bar'. Breakfast was poor, obviously attacked by those catching early flights in the morning before business people arise, but still it looked and felt like a motorway service station... Taxi's don't know the way and those that do drive around a bit to make the fare up - I gave up on this hotel after three nights, its a franchise of the IHG group and certainly not up to scratch - moved on to a different hotel for the remainder of my stay... I wouldn't recommend this to anyone other than a traveller on a quick stop over, although don't expect a good nights sleep, I have laid my head down on more comfortable breeze blocks than the bed here...Internet is 10 euros a day by the way...

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, terrible location.”
Reviews.Author: patzeric
Reviews.Content: The rooms in this hotel are fine. The hotel is new, and the rooms are perfectly good. However, where this hotel falls down in the location. The location is just horrible. There are no restaurants that you can walk to, and nothing nearby except for a business building and empty lots. There seems to be construction going on around the hotel, so may be in a couple of years it will be better, but for now I cannot recommend it. The only food choices are telepizza or a single restaurant that the shuttle will take you to. The hotel is also quite far away, by road, from the airport. The ride is at least 20-30 minutes. Given the bad location, there must be better choices out there.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as other reviewers say”
Reviews.Author: Lailasmom
Reviews.Content: Having a non-refundable booking for this hotel for our last two nights without reading the reviews, and then later reading the reviews, I found myself dreading our two nights staying there. I chose the hotel because it claimed to be near the airport. I was relieved to find out that the hotel wasn't as horrible as the other reviewers described. It was in the middle of nowhere but we easily caught the shuttle from the airport to the hotel for 9 euros a person (we found it was per person the day we left) and arrived at a clean typical Holiday Inn hotel. Our room wasn't huge but it was adequate for two adults and two kids. The bathroom was huge and modern and the room was clean and comfortable. The TV had about 6 channels so we watched a lot of MTV and Eurosport at night. We weren't using it as a base to travel in Madrid. I booked the hotel so the we could make our early flight the day we left (we easily caught the 6 am shuttle). There is no restaurant for dinner, only breakfast but it was free and had a plentiful amount of food. There is a really good American style restaurant about a 10 minute walk over the highway bridge directly on the other side of the highway so the first night we had dinner there. We also were able to catch a bus in front of the rib restaurant to go into Madrid to catch the metro and a train to Toledo our last day. Javier, the guy at the desk was really nice and helpful. So I wouldn't choose to stay there again but did not have the truly terrible experiences the other reviewers had.

Reviews.Title: “---don't book Express By Holiday Inn Madrid Aeropuerto---”
Reviews.Author: tufast4bulls
Reviews.Content: I had a terrible stay at the Express By Holiday Inn Madrid Aeropuerto. I booked the hotel on 11 July 09 for one night and it took 2 hours to get from the airport to the hotel, a one mile journey! I was hot and tired from traveling all day and the last thing I wanted is a poorly managed system to get to the hotel. Upon arriving at the airport in Madrid, I went down to the lower level where hotel buses pick up passengers. At least I thought. I’m an experienced traveler and I know how airports work. I didn’t see any signs for this particular hotel so I approached a small, blue booth that says, “Hotel transfers” above the window. I ask the girl if Holiday Inn has a bus and she said I must call the hotel. “Hummm……..that’s not a good answer” I thought to myself. I mean, the sign does say ‘hotel transfers’, but I went with it. I dig out a 2 Euro coin, the only coin I have, and use a pay phone. And, by the way, making phone calls in foreign countries is a whole other adventure in itself, equal to having your teeth drilled. (2 Euro is worth about 3 dollars US…so I made a $3 phone call that lasted 40 seconds.) So I call the hotel and the man answers and tells me to look for the bus ‘Aero City‘. “Aero City?” I ask him, and I ask him to spell it. “Okay, I’ll try to find the Aero City bus.” He then mentions the bus charges 9 Euro. Oh, that’s great. 9 Euros (about $12) to take a bus 1 mile. Now that’s worth coming back to this hotel for. Anyway, I go outside to the hotel bus stand and carefully watch for the Aero City bus. Many buses come and go; hotel buses, tour buses, parking lot buses. I wait 15 minutes. The 25 minutes. Finally I’m up to 55 minutes, no Aero City bus. Suddenly, I find myself at a major decision point in my life. Do I continue to wait for a fictitious bus, or do I go back inside for more mental gymnastics and risk missing my ride. My only other option was getting a taxi, which I asked about, and they charge 25 Euros. I’ll be damned if I’m going to pay a taxi $40 US to go 1 mile. Oh well, I go back inside and pass by an information booth and ask if they’ve heard of this Aero City bus. “Yes, senor, but you must go down to the Aero City bus desk.” the lady says in broken English. Really! There’s an Aero City bus desk? Wow! This is a major break through! So I go back to the area where I was before and look for the Aero City desk. Nothing. I walk up and down. Nothing. Well…it couldn’t hurt to ask, I go back to the ’Hotel transfers’ desk and ask the girl, “I’m sorry to bother you again but do you know where I can find the Aero City bus desk?” “Yes, you must book it here.” My eyes almost burst! If this were a Warner Brothers cartoon you would have seen steam shoot out my ears. “WHAT”!!!!!!!!!!!!! “You mean to tell me that I asked you a hour and a half ago how to get to the hotel and you didn’t book it then, you told me to call the hotel and the idiot at the hotel told me to look for the Aero City bus, and the bus doesn’t exist and I was suppose to book the bus with you FROM THE VERY BEGINNING!!!! “ Needless to say I was furious. How was I suppose to know where to book the bus? The guy at the hotel told me to LOOK for the bus. That doesn’t mean go to a booth and book a bus. AND, the booth doesn’t have Aero city written anywhere on it. How am I suppose to know all of this if you don’t tell me. The girl in the booth thought is was funny. When she called the driver to come over and pick me up (speaking in Spanish), she was laughing all through the conversation. Express By Holiday Inn Madrid Aeropuerto is a terrible hotel. If any manager has the time to read this report I hope you do something about it. I started at the right place and the girl sent me away. That person should be fired. From her laughter I bet she does this to other passengers. And the idiot at the hotel needs to say go to the Hotel transfer booth, not look for a bus. Oh, by the way, the Aero City bus has no markings. It’s just a blue van that someone drives. Therefore, impossible to identify. The return trip (the next day) to the airport cost me another 9 Euros and to make matters worse, if that’s possible, I asked to charge the 9 Euro to my hotel room bill. I have an account and it will cover the 9 Euro. “Sure senor, no problem.” They said they could add it to the hotel bill. The next morning I get down to the front desk at 7 am and they can’t add it to the bill. Yet again, another misadvisement. Par for the course for this stupid hotel. Bottom line, don’t book Express By Holiday Inn Madrid Aeropuerto. Maybe business will drop off and they will wake up and manage their hotel transfer program better. Thx tufast4bulls@msn.com

Reviews.Title: “Not So Much A Stay - More A Prison Sentence”
Reviews.Author: cryhavoc
Reviews.Content: If there is anyone in the film industry looking for a location for the next big Hollywood post apocalyptic blockbuster - this is your place. Only a 25 euro trip from Madrid Airport and you will have the scene of a Mad Max movie. Don't stay here for any other reason though. At least in prison I'm sure you can get a hot meal. Here you have a machine that dispenses overpriced tasteless sandwiches. Avoid !!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “HolidaY Inn Express Madrid Aiport Not near airport at all”
Reviews.Author: jajajajajajaja
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located on an construction site no sight at all but land and construction building it was a 15 drive from the hotel and it clearly said Holiday Inn Airport well NOT! Vending machine severly overpriced no dinner just ordering pizza from another company one pizza unbeknowest to me cost me 25,00 euro's and a medium one at that. Staff very unproffesional hardly any English and no hospitality training receptionist got very annoyed at one point when I was asking questions. Airconditioning is not working only the heater which seemed to be centrally controlled asked rec. about it again very annoyed and said it was a central fault hotel hot as hell. Room clean, small 2 english channels, no gym, no swimming pool, no sauna not entertainment JUST A BORING HOTEL AND ANNOYED STAFF NEVER WILL USE AGAIN A WASTE OF MONEY.

Reviews.Title: “Poor location”
Reviews.Author: Bully1959Canaries
Reviews.Content: Not easy to get too from airport. Cheaper to use taxi than shuttle bus. Hotel not near anything. Not ideal would not use again.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid the Holiday Inn Express Madrid "Airport"”
Reviews.Author: HonorCrown
Reviews.Content: We thought this would be a convenient near-the-airport short-stay site. We were very disappointed. It cost us Euros 15 from the airport, and once we arrived we found ourselves in an isolated industrial park. DO NOT STAY AT THIS HOTEL IF YOU DO NOT HAVE A CAR! While new, the hotel is already falling into disrepair...our sink had no stopper and the furnishings showed wear. The rooms are very small, and if the mini-sofa is opened to accomodate kids, this takes up all the floor space in the room, without any gap between the parents sleeping area and the kids. There are no restaurants in the area, so the only place to eat is the hotel itself...and the atmosphere is industrial (in the austere lobby with a parking lot view) while the food is overpriced. To get anywhere at all, you need to walk several blocks and across a bridge to a bus stop. To reach Madrid, you need to do that walk, plus the bus, plus a subway ride...and a transfer on the subway to reach most tourist destinations. For most tourists, it is far better to stay in downtown Madrid

Reviews.Title: “Holiday Inn Express Madrid Airport difficult to access on a late flight”
Reviews.Author: RossScotland
Reviews.Content: We arrived at this hotel at midnight as our flight had been delayed. The courtesy bus finished at 11:30pm and the taxi drivers are at liberty to charge as much as they like. A five minute journey cost us 52 euros for two taxies for 5 people with no other options available. The hotel is isolated, not well manned at night and the queue was long; it took us 30 minutes to get checked in. On first sight the hotel looks extremely basic but the rooms were clean and modern and the breakfast was ok. The morning staff were good, but the hotel is remote and transportation from the hotel is dependant on the courtesy bus or taxis. Also the initial booking does not show the VAT added to all rooms in Spain.

Reviews.Title: “Just a for a short Stay”
Reviews.Author: Fred_1000_R
Reviews.Content: Definitively a pass thru Hotel. The hotel is located on a construction site area. In fact is the only thing around. Taxi drivers don’t even know were it is located. I had to call from my cell phone so the taxi could get directions (25 euros). In Fact some one told me taxis say don’t know location because is to close to the airport and they what a better fare. It has virtually no restaurant. Only breakfast or order in pizza. Hotel arrival is after 3:00pm if you arrive earlier even if they are rooms you wil not get one. If you what to check earlier they will charge you extra night. In this hotel you better have cash in euros for vending machines, Pizza delivery etc.. There is a Hotel Shuttle for 7euros per person. The rest it’s clean, small rooms, no money exchange in the hotel and new rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Ive stayed in”
Reviews.Author: drgodwin
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the worst branded star hotel which I have stayed in. I noticed 4 most annoying things and it is an absolute scam run by this hotel. I feel robbed. 1. The day I checked into the hotel with my family there was no air conditioning. Only the heater was working. When I enquired they said its not summer as yet. And summer will start the next day and then only the A/C (Cool air) will work. When asked what to do, they said you can leave the windows open. The next 2 days were the same. We slept with the windows open and this hotel is close to the airport (2 flights every 3 minutes) so you can literally count the number of planes landing and taking off. We had 3 nights of very bad sleep. 2. The last day when we had to check out they said the breakfast would be open only at 7.30AM. The brekfast was ready from 6.00AM itself. It was all arranged but we were told not to have a bite at all. Another 3 Hong Kong tourists and 3 Japanese tourists staying at the hotel were told the same. It is miserable not to have atleast a coffee when everything is at place from 6.00 in the morning itself. Especially with children and family accompanying you. 3. The staff at the counter are the most irresponsible and discourteous bunch of people working for this reputed brand name. 4. Being a brand name hotel the internet could have been provided free for all who stayed at the hotel. We had to go down to the lobby to collect the username and password and the time of 1 hr started from the time of issue of the paper to you. I lost 20 minutes of the 1 hr I paid for just getting back to the room. Turning on the computer. Putting in the username and password. And starting browsing. It is just daylight robbery. 5. They even dont have a complimetary pickup and drop at the airport which is just 5 minutes form from their hotel. 6. No room service for anything. 7. The food vending machine at the lobby takes only the money. It only dispenses some items. Lost 4 Euros like that when I ordered for 2 Ham Sandwiches. 8. The carpets leading to our room had on offensive odour. 9. There is no transportation near by. Everything is 14 Euros away on Taxi. So its 28 Euros for 1 trip everyday on Cabs till the TRAMS, Bus stand etc. If you are looking for budjet travel not this hotel. I didnt expect all this from a Hotel with a brand name like Holiday Inn. Really me and my family were thoroughly disappointed with this hotel and we feel swindled at this point. We had stayed in 2 other hotels in Spain on this leg of the tour and they were fantastic. Below I am giving you the details of my reservation. Room Type: STANDARD ROOM - 4 PERSON(S) MAX PER ROOM BRAND NEW DESIGN COMPLIMENTARY BUFFET BREAKFAST TEA AND COFFEE MAKING FACILITIES HAIRDRYER BATH WITH POWER SHOWER PLASMA TV TELEPHONE MODEM ACCESS WITH HIGH SPEED INTERNET AIRCONDITIONING NO ROLLAWAY BED POSSIBLE MAX 2 ADULTS OR 2 ADULTS WITH 2 CHILDREN I think all the facilities are written but everything you have to pay excess including the airconditioning. Most miserable deal ever. I was told by one of the staff internet access is written but I will have to pay for it. Miserable really.

Reviews.Title: “Only as a last resort stay here.”
Reviews.Author: ceoltoir
Reviews.Content: Our experience was similar to all the other negative reviews for this hotel. We could not find it in our rental car despite directions, maps and GPS. After driving around for an hour we gave up and returned our car to the airport but then had to get to the hotel. None of the taxi drivers at the airport had heard of it or its address and the one that took us finally had to call the hotel to get directions and charged us 24 euros. It is located in an ugly construction zone with nothing near - no restaurants or places to walk around outside. To get into Madrid for our last night in Spain we had to walk a 1/4 mile through a construction site to a bus station on the busy N2 road. Because we were afraid a taxi would not find us in the morning to get to the airport we took the hotel shuttle and were ripped off for 7 euros each (21 euros for a family of 3 ) for a 7 minute trip. The Holiday Inn chain should be ashamed to give its name to this place!

Reviews.Title: “Average for an airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: jcniii
Reviews.Content: Yes, I agree this hotel seems to be in the middle of nowhere and is not easy to find. I had printed directions off of a major Internet site and let's just say the directions almost got us killed once or twice having us make immediate turns on the freeways!!! and actually the directions were wrong! After calling the hotel from my cell phone we got directions from our lost position and fortunately stumbled upon the place. The hotel is brand new and yes in an area where they are obviously adding more "overnight stay" hotels. The place was very clean and the staff was friendly. It actually only took us 10 minutes to drive to the airport from this place which is located off the A-2 in Madrid(wish I had known that to begin with as we would have found it much quicker). My biggest complaint was that the air conditioning was not working. When we asked the front desk they told us it was not cold enough yet to have it on and to open the window in our room. Since it had been very hot that day it was stiffling all night in the room and we got little sleep. I will say though even with the window open it was relatively quiet. I think they are trying to improve things though as there are signs at the round about pointing to the hotel. At 60 Euros a night we got what we paid for.

Reviews.Title: “worst hotel”
Reviews.Author: ybkh
Reviews.Content: we have just returned a 5 day trip from madrid (holiday inn).The hotel was in the construction area, and even the traveler agents bus couldnt find it. The hotel was clean but the breakfast was awfull.

Reviews.Title: “no other word than HORRIBLE”
Reviews.Author: umdiewlt
Reviews.Content: I can only agree with every word said by the previous reviews, If you are depressed you risk suicide! The taxidriver who brought me there felt pity for me. The location is abosultely the worst hotel location I ever saw in my life. Just to add two small things to the previous reviews: no adapter but for american plugs but I am from Italy and there was no adapter so lost in the mid of nowhere I could not even use my labtop. A word to the dinner in the hotel ( no other chance to get someting to eat as you have to walk at least for 20 min through dirty constructing areas and over the highway to find a place). On the menu with very limted choice I chose a steamed fish. The fish was steemed (maybe) but before steeming it was panfried! Taxi to downtown Madrid 25 euro to go and 25 to go back. I usually try to find something positive in life, here there is no way. Try to avoid this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this hotel”
Reviews.Author: dlf_fla
Reviews.Content: Only if you're desperate should you stay here. First, the hotel sits in the middle of a major construction zone--there is no way to walk to anything even though the website says they're next to the biggest mall in Spain. Even the taxi from the airport had trouble finding a way in. I asked about restaurants and was told it would be better to order from my room for a delivery service. (I think it's because of their location amidst all this construction). Second, their airport shuttle doesn't run unless you call them and then they told me only in the morning. There is no sign on the airport shuttle stop that lists all the hotels having a shuttle. They did run in the morning back to the airport but once I got in was told the charge was 7 euros. Third, the room air conditioning didn't work. I opened the window in the middle of the night and had to listen to some sort of clanging sound all night. Fourth, unlike other American chain hotels in Spain (such as the Mariott Renaisance at the Barcelona Airport) there is no iron in the room as the web site advertises. Avoid this place--there are lots of other inexpensive hotels near the airport that offer better service such as Best Western, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Ever!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Nayi220
Reviews.Content: I wish I would have read the previous comments before going to this hotel. Yes, it's clean but besides that, it's a terrible hotel. I stayed there just for one day and I was counting the minutes to get out of there. There is absolutely nothing around there...except buildings under construction. The web page lied about it being near the airport..it's not. The web page also states that there is a/c..yeah right. It seems that when it is a bit cool outside, they turn it off. I thought it was broken but when I asked the staff they told me that fifteen days ago they turned it off because it was a bit cool outside. It was so freakin' hot in there, that wearing clothes is not an option. I tried to make calls and none of the phones worked. I had to call a cab to take me into the city centre to find a calling place. The Staff was so cold, unhelpful, and rude. They do not want to be bothered with any problems guests are having. Unless you want to ruin your vacation, DO NOT STAY HERE!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “terrible”
Reviews.Author: judyScotland
Reviews.Content: This has to be the worst Holiday Inn hotel I have ever stayed in . I have always stayed with Holiday Inn hotels as I find them to be reliable, friendly and value for money. However, this hotel is none of those. It is in the middle of a building site, the staff are un helpful and it costs 30 euros in a taxi from the airport, which is the sme cost to go to the main city centre (this is supposed to be the airport hotel??) the staff on reception appear to think it is rude for a guest to turn up and interrupt thier converstions they so often have at the main reception desk with a check in or a query. I was informed by the staff at reception that if I was in any doubt booking taxi's from the train station that I should ring the hotel and they would sort it for me, which I thought was very kind of them. However, I did ring the hotel and ask them to sort me a taxi when I was stuck and I was told by the girl on the phone to get the bus!!!!! I cannot stress enough how utterly horrible this hotel and staff are. Please book elswhere and avoid the same experience.
